instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP3V0_G3H: What is PP3V0_G3H? PP3V0_G3H is a 3.0v power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state..
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S5_L: What is PM_SLP_S5_L? PM_SLP_S5_L is a signal that, when 3.3v, turns on power rails that will wake the system from an S5 state. This signal is a part of the power management system of the MacBook.  The \"PM\" prefix typically stands for \"Power Management,\" and the \"SLP\" is for \"Sleep.\" The \"S5\" denotes the specific sleep state, which is Suspend to Disk, and the \"_L\" suffix indicates that this is an active low signal..
definitions.P5VG3S_EN: What is P5VG3S_EN? This signal enables the PP5V_G3S power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged
threads.message: Hi, I have a liquid damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (macbook pro 15 inch touchbar 2018), board looks pretty clean. Doesnt turn on, but is taking a charge 20v and 2.x A. I have no schematics for this board. What other board comes close that is available?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged
threads.message:
No schematic available.
Does it charge the battery?
2A is high current for non working board.
Did you try to start in SMC bypass mode?
Any USB activity?
Liquid signs around CPU, or backlight area, LCD connector?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged
threads.message: 2 Amps means it?s turning on...any USB activity or video of any kind?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged
threads.message: I have the same board with water damage and the exact same problem, it takes 1.4 Amp, turns on and shows an empty battery sign, but doesn't charge the battery(or a new battery) and then turns off and goes to 0 Amp, what is SMC bypass mode? How can I try the SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged
threads.message: Start a new post.....do NOT extend old posts with new ones.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged
threads.message: I finally got the boardview and schematics for this board so back at it. Now when I connect the charger, I get 20v and 0.9A. Does this mean the charge circuit works but its not booting?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged
threads.message:
Which voltages present?
Do you get VCORE?
Check for USB activity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged
threads.message:
I checked all the power lines and I am missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL>, so I will get started from there. Here are all the readings, 12.63 on PPBUS seems too low?


Charge = 20v    0.08A
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.63
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.39
<SIGNAL>PP3V0_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 5.13v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> = 0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged
threads.message:
Which schematic use for this?
Any pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S5_L</SIGNAL>?
Check it triggering <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> signal.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged
threads.message:
I have the boardview for 01041 but the schematics that came with it only had 3 pages :(. Anyway, I checked for enable signal <SIGNAL>P5VG3S_EN</SIGNAL> and its 3.3, so i tried to replace <CHIP>U7650</CHIP>, now i get 1v at <SIGNAL>P5VG3S_VFB1</SIGNAL>, no short, assuming thats the outgoing 5v signal since i dont have schematics.

I will check these other values when im back at office tomorrow, thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged
threads.message: Upload somewhere the papers you have for this board...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damaged
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>P5VG3S_EN</SIGNAL> and its 3.3"
In such case, <SIGNAL>5V_G3S</SIGNAL> power supply is enabled.

"i get 1v at <SIGNAL>P5VG3S_VFB1</SIGNAL>"
This copuld be good, as is the feedback input.
Check if <RESISTOR>R7677</RESISTOR>-79 are good, as their traces too.
Also check R/<CAPACITOR>C7609</CAPACITOR> and <RESISTOR>R7665</RESISTOR>.
Post diode mode on L7600.
